title: kiltie_loafers
body:
A type of slip-on dress [[shoes|shoe]] characterized by decorative leather fringes on the upper vamp of the shoe. The fringe, called a kiltie, is reminiscent of the fringed flaps on traditional Scottish [[kilt]]s, hence the name.

h4. Related Tags:
* [[loafers]]
* [[penny loafers]]
* [[tassel loafers]]

title: crew_neck
body:
A type of [[shirt]], [[sweater]], [[dress]], or other top with a round, close-fitting neckline. The crew neck gets its name from its association with rowing teams and other athletic crews who originally wore this style of shirt.

h4. Characteristics:

* [b]Shape:[/b] The defining feature of a crew neck is its round, circular neckline. It does not have a collar and is typically higher than other necklines, such as a [[V-neck]] or [[scoop neck]].
* [b]Fit:[/b] The neckline sits snugly around the base of the neck without any plunging or revealing cuts.

h4. Related Tags:
* [[V-neck]]: For garments with a V-shaped neckline.
* [[scoop neck]]: For garments with a wide, rounded neckline that is lower than a crew neck.
* [[turtleneck]]: For garments with a high, close-fitting collar that covers the neck.

title: izumi-no-kami_kanesada
body:
A [i][[Touken Ranbu]][/i] character, the personification of the historical [[katana|uchigatana]] [i]Izumi-no-Kami Kanesada[/i]. 
Character designed by [[Shiramine (srmn09)|]], voiced by [[Kimura Ryouhei]]. 

He was formerly classified by the game as a tachi until July 2015. Both he and [[Horikawa Kunihiro]] are personifications of swords that belonged to [[Hijikata Toshizou]] of the [[Shinsengumi]]. He was asked to be made after the Shinsengumi started to become well known, and Hijikata thus sought after a swordsmith from the Kanesada school, requesting that his new sword be similar to his [[wakizashi]] (Horikawa). This is likely the reason why Izumi-no-kami and Horikawa have the same hair and eye color. He is still around today, located in the Hijikata Toshizou Museum in his hometown of Hino, [[Tokyo (city)|]].

h4. Appearance
[tn]See post #1934098 for base form.[/tn]

He has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with part of it done in a [[side braid]], and [[blue eyes]]. He typically wears [[earrings]], [[Japanese clothes]], black [[fingerless gloves]], and a [[cape]] with the Shinsengumi's distinctive blue and white pattern. For his [[Izumi-no-kami Kanesada (Kiwame)|Kiwame]] form, he puts his hair up in a [[ponytail]] and wears a white [[headband]], a Shinsengumi [[haori]] and black [[knee boots]]. 

Despite looking like an adult, he is technically the youngest character in the game, being the most recently forged sword as he was made in 1867. Because of this, he often comes across as reckless and a bit overconfident, which is why Horikawa often has to assist him or reign him in. Much of his personality is also inspired by the real-life Hijikata.

h4. Alternate outfits/forms
* !post #1934099: Alternate
* !post #2891421: [[Izumi-no-kami Kanesada (Kiwame)|Kiwame form]]

title: asura_(mythology)
body:
A mythological race of demonic beings which feature prominently in [[Hindu mythology]] and [[Buddhism]]. They are primarily malevolent, and are in a constant struggle against the gods for power. However some benevolent asuras also exist, which are typically depicted as protectors of justice and destroyers of evil.

They are usually depicted with [[extra faces|multiple faces]] (typically four placed around a single head) and [[extra arms]] (typically four or eight). Each face may express a different emotion.

title: 833_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21075513

Voice of [[Hakurei Reimu]] in [[cookie (touhou)|Kasu☆]]. Pronounced "Hasami", the Japanese word for [[scissors]]. Has completely disappeared from the internet. 

She was the main character of Kasu☆, but a lack of good artists led to this single frame being chosen as her representation similar to [[Jigen (cookie)|]] and [[Koga (cookie)|]]. Because her face varied so much from frame to frame, this led to the joke that her face is a [[mask]] and her real face drives people mad. This, combined with her name and Jigen being reassigned as gunslinging badass led to 833 becoming a hitman that uses scissors as her signature weapon.

title: meguru_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21075205

One of the voices of [[Kirisame Marisa]] in [[Atouda Ako (character)|]]'s [[cookie_(touhou)|Kuso☆☆☆☆]], by far the most popular one. Didn't really understand the Cookie community before agreeing to be in the voice drama. Has stayed relatively silent since then, largely disappearing by 2016. 

Her design is based on [[Azusa (cookie)|]]'s, with a [[red bow|red]] [[hat bow]], a [[red bowtie]], [[blue eyes]] with [[white pupils]], very distinct [[blush stickers]] and are sometimes mistaken for [[extra mouth]]s, [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], a [[black capelet]], a [[black vest]], and a [[brown apron|brown]] [[waist apron]]. She initially wasn't a very popular character, but her natural pairing with [[Yuuhi (cookie)|]] expanded both of their popularities. 

Starting in 2017, MADs of her started to get created by various people on NicoNico, but the big breakthrough happened with a remix of "Logic Airforce":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GBPnA2BgqLg] by [[Hirasawa Susumu]] of [[P-Model]]. Another remix of "LAB=01":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pmcvRQdIn-Y] became even more popular and an [[UTAU]] called MGRoid was created which sounded surprisingly good. Since then, MGR became Cookie's representative in the vocal synth community with extremely high popularity in the Chinese Cookie community on BiliBili. She was dubbed "Hirasawa's Daughter" and has been remixed singing all of his most famous songs. Besides MGRoid, a few other running jokes appear:
* Misreading MGR as maguro ([[tuna]]) or [[Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance]]
* Mistaking her [[blush stickers]] as [[extra mouth]]s, complimenting the monstrous [[Yuuhi (cookie)|]]
* Her mangling Souraze「そうらぜ」 as Soudaze「そうだぜ」: Compared to [[Miura Daisenpai]]'s so~dayo line
* [[Fake Meguru (cookie)|]]: a derivative character that only bears a passing resemblance, started in 2022 by Atouda Ako

title: yuuhi_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21075139
* !asset #21075140: twitter icon

One of the voices of [[Kirisame Marisa]] in [[Atouda Ako (character)|]]'s [[cookie_(touhou)|Kuso☆☆☆☆]]. Is a bit touch and go with the Cookie community, but creates new accounts every now and then to answer questions. Her popularity also comes and goes since she tried to organize a voice drama but it fell through after some internal controversy. Identifiable by her [[sleeves past fingers]], slanted [[black eyes]], and [[blue bow|blue]] [[hat bow]]. Almost always paired with [[Meguru (cookie)|]]. 

Her design is theoretically based on [[Uzuki (cookie)|]]'s but there is almost no resemblance. By far Yuuhi's most common appearance is as a companion of some kind to Meguru. Sometimes this is interpreted as [[yuri]], a kid and their [[monster girl|pet monster]], or just as friends. [[Monsterification]] of her is because of her strange eyes and the fact you never see her hands, started by [[tenten_(nicoseiga18696142)|]].

title: ruka_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21074901

One of the voices of [[Kirisame Marisa]] in [[Atouda Ako (character)|]]'s [[cookie_(touhou)|Kuso☆☆☆☆]] and several of his voice dramas afterwards. Seems to genuinely enjoy both Cookie and Touhou. Identifiable by the [[star hat ornament|stars dangling from her hat]], and wearing either grey or blue compared to Marisa's usual black. 

Due to her short screentime she isn't a very popular character but still has a few fans. A common running joke came from one of her Q&A videos where she used [[hyoushigi]] in between questions. This led to jokes about her having a [[huge_weapon|gigantic sword]] that she was clacking against the ground instead. Once accidentally showed her face on stream and got compared to Asashoryu Akinori.

title: shiromiya_rei
body:
* !asset #21074825

Voice of [[Hakurei Reimu]] in [[Atouda Ako (character)|]]'s [[cookie_(touhou)|Kuso☆☆☆☆]]. She is depicted as Reimu with [[black hair]], [[swept bangs]], a large [[forehead]], no frills on her [[hair bow]], and without hair tubes. [spoiler] This is how [[Benikurage (cookie)|]] looks in real life. [/spoiler] She largely disappeared from the internet in 2016, only collaborating on a song with [[Ruka (cookie)|]] in 2018.

In fandom, she is depicted as the most sane out of all the Reimus, due to her largely being the voice of reason / [[fourth wall]] breaks in the voice drama. Her line "Korette Touhou voice drama ja nai no?!?" (Isn't this a Touhou voice drama?!?) is her most parodied line. She is sometimes associated with [[Miramikaru Riran]] but this depicted fell off after [[Riran Youkyu]]. For some reason also has a lot of pictures with [[armpit hair]].

title: ichigo_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21073780
* !asset #21073781: ASKICG

Voice of [[Alice Margatroid]] in [[Atouda Ako (character)|]]'s [[cookie_(touhou)|Kuso☆☆☆]]. Instantly became popular for her incredibly soft-spoken and weak voice. Was never very active in the Cookie community and left during the Cookie Freeze Festival of 2018 where several directors and actresses had false DMCA's end their twitter and NND accounts. However in 2020 a fan discovered her new twitter account and another fan named Ryo-IchigoKnight, a middle school girl, doxxed her leading Ichigo to delete her account. Three weeks later Ryo committed suicide by train on the Tobo-Tojo line.

Ichigo's depiction is almost entirely based on fan art instead of her personal life or actions in the voice drama. She has an unusually high amount of memes due to how popular Kuso☆☆☆ became.
* Her most famous scene was her buying ingredients at a store owned by [[Nyon (cookie)|]] while [[Akira (cookie)|]] rambled about the history of Valentine's day. Her [[desk slam|slamming the counter]] and telling Nyon "Why don't you quit this job!?" when Nyon didn't have any ingredients became the most famous. 
* NYNICG became her most popular ship because of this. MADs featuring their adventures are now some of Cookie's most popular videos.
* Her line "Ikuyo!" also became famous and copied, usually paired with the thrusters with [[arrow (symbol)|]]s on them from [[Algodoo]] based on an [[Manatsu no yo no Inmu|Inmu]] series of MADs. 
* Ichigo was a fan of [[Miffy]], and combined with Alice being a puppeteer and the Aldogoo thrusters, she began to be drawn as [[telekinesis|telekinetic]]. She is usually see controlling her [[stuffed rabbit]], [[Fluffy fluffy Rabbit-chan]].
* She joined the ALC Faction with the other famous Alices, but in particular started getting paired with [[Jigen (cookie)|]]. 
* Some [[graffiti]] of her appeared on an abandoned building in Kanagawa: https://archive.is/gNL5z
* Her alternate appearance as ASKICG came from an interview video she did. Instead of Alice, she appears as a girl with [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]], a [[strawberry hair ornament|strawberry]] [[red hairband|hairband]], a [[pink capelet]] with a [[purple necktie]], and a [[green dress]].
* MADs of her dancing to [[Mettaton]]'s theme went viral.

title: protected_link
body:
A post whose source is only visible to certain users. This includes posts that are followers-only, login-only, password-protected, or other forms of limiting access by the artist.

This can include limiting the picture to certain sizes only, to flat-out denying access to the picture at all.

This does not include posts that were deleted by the artist ([[bad id]]s) or [[paid reward]]s.

h4. See also

* [[bad id]]
* [[inactive account]]
* [[paid reward]]

title: suzu_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21073548

Voice of [[Kirisame Marisa]] in [[Atouda Ako (character)|]]'s [[cookie_(touhou)|Kuso☆☆☆]]. Recognizable for her nearly always [[closed eyes]], [[star (symbol)|]]s on her vest instead of buttons, and a [[red bow]] in her hair. Her [[witch hat]] sometimes [[living clothes|comes alive]] too. Known for having the worst microphone of all of Kuso. Escaped Cookie fairly quickly so all of her jokes are either from the voice drama or were made up afterwards in MADs and fan art. 

While [[Hinase (cookie)|]] is depicted as a yandere, [[Rurima (cookie)|]] as permanently angry, and [[Noel (cookie)|]] as cold and distant, Suzu is the murderous psycopath. This started as in the voice drama Marisa completely ignored Reimu's feeling for her, but morphed into a general lack of empathy. She started to get drawn with [[knife|knives]] and [[chainsaw]]s and covered in [[blood]], especially hunting after [[JOKER (cookie)|]]. In contrast she is depicted as extremely flustered by anything romantic or sexual.

No one really knows why Suzu and JOKER are shipped together so often. Suzu at one point made a joke about her parents thought she was a lesbian in high school, but other than that it is a mystery to all.

title: hotaruda_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21073035

A derivative character that combined [[Shinonome (cookie)|]] and [[Sakenomi (cookie)|]]. "Hotaru" means firefly, as a reference to how Eirin stuck a flashlight up Reimu's ass in the original voice drama. Got more popular after appearing in [[OFFSide: DIYUSI]] and is now drawn more with those characters than Shinonome herself.

title: shinonome_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21073001

Voice of [[Hakurei Reimu]] in [[Atouda Ako (character)|]]'s [[cookie_(touhou)|Kuso☆☆]] with her name based on [[professor_shinonome|Shinonome Hakase]]. Identifiable by her [[black hair]] and [[black eyes]] with [[white pupils]] and a [[lab coat]]. Says she largely regrets doing Cookie voice acting since it makes all Touhou secondary works look bad. 

Her role in the voice drama was Reimu who needed to get her ass checked, but fan works like to depict her as the doctor as the other members of the voice drama had more popular roles elsewhere. Running jokes about her usually involve her ass [[glowing]], a [[peach]] since it is ass-shaped, or as a mad [[scientist]]. Spawned the Sakenomi-like [[Hotaruda (cookie)|]].

title: yayoi_usagi
body:
* !asset #21072940

Voice of [[Alice Margatroid]] in [[Atouda Ako (character)|]]'s [[cookie_(touhou)|Kuso☆]]. Also disappeared soon after the voice drama aired, but came back a few years later. After a random Russian used her old twitter name and revealing she was from Shiga prefecture where the original [[ninja]]s were from, fans began to draw her as a ninja using the sarashi she wore in the voice drama as a mask.

title: mai_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21072933


Voice of [[Patchouli Knowledge]] in [[Atouda Ako (character)|]]'s [[cookie_(touhou)|Kuso☆]]. There was a rumor that she was a foreigner so her name is written in all lowercase like the cast of Easter☆. Disappeared almost immediately after the voice drama came out, taking [[Yuwo (cookie)|]]'s title of "Cookie's fastest woman".

title: mikami_makoto
body:
* !asset #21072849
* !asset #21072858
* !asset #21072876

Voice of [[Kirisame Marisa]] in [[Atouda Ako (character)|]]'s [[cookie_(touhou)|Kuso☆]], she has also been involved in every level of several dozen other voice dramas by planning, directing, drawing, singing, remixing, writing, and [[Vocaloid]] producing. While initially unpopular due to the many other Marisas and having a small part in Kuso☆, her popular and acting skill grew with every production she did. Now works as a freelance music producer for other dramas.

Her appearance in Kuso☆ was mostly overshadowed by [[Noel (cookie)|]] but her following voice dramas slowly built her popularity, especially since her chain-smoker voice was unique. She is a fan of [[military]] dramas, and is now most often depicted as Marisa in a [[military uniform]]. For a while she used a picture of [[Tatara Kogasa]] with an [[eyepatch]] as her avatar on twitter. Her work as an R18 voice and skill with video editing usually means people hold her in higher regard than most other actresses.

title: noel_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21072843
* !asset #21072844

Voice of [[hakurei_reimu|Reimu]] in [[Atouda Ako (character)|]]'s [[cookie_(touhou)|Kuso☆]]. The only thing know about her is that she is an artist by profession. Her acting was clear and she had a cute voice, so she maintained a constant level of popularity.

She is strongly associated with [[sumo]] and often holds a [[gunbai]] [[war fan]] and [[enema]], based on the voice drama. Her fearless attitude of organizing laxative sumo match in the video led people to depict her as someone who is so confident in their strength they take their life very easy. She gained more popularity as a main character in [[OFFSide: DIYUSI]] as the [[empty eyes|empty-eyed]] merchant, who knows more than they let on.

title: nero_(devil_may_cry)
body:
[b]The Devil Hunter, Nero[/b]

Nero is the main protagonist of [[Devil May Cry 4]], whom Sanctus makes multiple references to being "a descendant with Sparda's blood". He's a Holy Knight in the Order of the Sword, a religious order that worships Sparda and fights to protect the world from demons, also fighting to protect his childhood friend and love interest [[kyrie (devil may cry)|]]. 

He wields the [[Red Queen (sword)]], the [[Blue Rose (gun)]], and the [[Devil Bringer]], later lost and stolen in [[Devil May Cry 5]]. Voiced by [[Johnny Yong Bosch]] in North America, and [[Ishikawa Kaito|Kaito Ishikawa]] in Japan.

[spoiler]He is later revealed in DMC5 that he is the son of [[Vergil (devil may cry)|]], as he has an innate resonance with his father's sword, the [[Yamato_(sword)|Yamato]], though there are multiple sources from [[Capcom]], including Hideaki Atsuno, that confirm Vergil's paternity over Nero that wasn't incorporated in DMC4's story for flexibility prior to the game's release.

title: bad_gun_anatomy
body:
Tag given to an image featuring a [[gun|firearm]] that is drawn such that it is: impossible to be used reasonably (ex: the stock is so long that it prohibits shouldering, lacking a trigger or means to fire, etc), absurd (ex: non-deliberate barrel curvature, abnormally large/small bore or barrel OD for the chambering and vice-versa, barrel/bolt coming out of an optic, etc), resembles a caricature of the firearm it is supposed to be, has overbearing errors (ex: whole cartridges being ejected or shot out, single action firearm going 'click click click', etc ), or just generally looks trash.

This tag should not be used to describe depictions of operator error such as backwards magazines or optics. It should also not be used to describe firearms that have small faults in furniture or continuity (ex: grip slightly too long or at slightly wrong angle, modern handguard on a vietnam-era ar, etc), or are deliberately comically large/small.

If [[antique firearm]] is applicable to the gun in question, then design faults should (most likely) be considered part of the style and not bad gun anatomy.

h4. See also
* [[anatomical nonsense]]
* [[artistic error]]
* [[bad anatomy]]
* [[bad gun anatomy]]
* [[bad vehicle anatomy]]
* [[cursed M4A1 (meme)]]
* [[engineering nonsense]]
* [[Tag Group:Image Composition]]

title: koutari_yuu
body:
A [[Black_Rock_Shooter|Black★Rock Shooter]] character, sharing physical characteristics with her other form [[Strength_(black_rock_shooter)|STR]]. Voiced by [[Asumi Kana]].

h4. Appearance
She is consistently portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]], plus being the shortest of the franchise's main characters. 

* !post #719432: 2010 version
* !post #1034770: 2012 version

In the 2010 OVA, she is portrayed with a white [[serafuku]] and [[blue sailor collar]], blue [[neckerchief]], and [[blue skirt]], the same outfit as her classmates.

In the 2012 series, she retains her base attributes but gains an [[orange hair ornament]] to her left and her hair is more neatly kept. In addition, her [[school uniform]] is changed to a [[white shirt]], blue [[bowtie]], brown [[blazer]], and white [[kneehighs]].

title: boku_no_kanojo_sensei
body:
[b]Boku no Kanojo Sensei[/b] (My Teacher-Girlfriend, 僕のカノジョ先生) is a romcom light novel series, written by Yuu Kagami (鏡遊), and illustrated by [[oryo (oryo04)|oryo]] (おりょう). It is now a completed series with nine volumes. A manga adaptation illustrated by [[sdwing]] began publication in 2019 and is currently ongoing.

The story revolves around the protagonist [[Saiki Makoto]], who has a distrust for teachers because of a past traumatic experience. One day he was confessed to by his teacher, [[Fujiki Maka]]. Ever since then she has been using every method she knows in order to pursue him in a form of “guidance counseling”.

h1.Characters 
* [[Fujiki Maka]]

* [[Keimi Shiya]]
* [[Saigi Miharu]]

title: megas_xlr_(mecha)
body:
The titular [[super robot]] [[mecha]] from the [[Megas XLR]] American animated TV show from 2004.

[b]MEGAS XLR[/b] stands for [b]M[/b]echanized [b]E[/b]arth [b]G[/b]uard [b]A[/b]ttack [b]S[/b]ystem e[b]X[/b]tra [b]L[/b]arge [b]R[/b]obot.

This robot is very powerful and has many weapons. It uses a [[muscle car]] as main cockpit, specifically an unlicensed approximation of a [[Plymouth Barracuda]], as they were unable to license the real car. 

The [[steering wheel]] of the car is actually used to control Megas, just like the [[Boss Borot]] robot from the old [[Mazinger Z]] Japanese anime series (probably as a tribute).

title: hong_kong_97
body:
A legendarily bad unlicensed video game for the [[Super Nintendo]], released in 1995. You play as Chin, [[Bruce Lee]]'s "relative", who is actually played by [[Jackie Chan]], and are tasked with killing 1.2 billion Mainland Chinese who invade during the 1997 handover of Hong Kong from the British Empire to communist China. After 5 minutes of a terrible [[danmaku]] game, [[Deng Xiaoping]] appears as a disembodied head to fight you. Also notable is the 3 second loop of "I love Beijing Tianamen":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mJmjljQP3oY] [i]with lyrics[/i] that replays endlessly even through loading screens.

The game went viral in the 2000s in gaming circles, and reached mass attention after being reviewed on [[Angry Video Game Nerd]] in 2015. More on the game's development and background, especially in relation to its creator, would be uncovered on Ultra Healthy Video Game Nerd.

title: portrait_of_king_charles_iii_(jonathan_yeo)
body:
The first official portrait of [[Charles III|King Charles III]] since his coronation in May 2023. The portrait, done by artist Jonathan Yeo, features Charles' face while his body blends into a bright [[red background]]. The portrait drew strong reactions and jokes on social media, with some claiming it looked demonic, as though Charles was in the fires of hell. After emerging online in mid-May 2024, the artwork inspired numerous memes using it as an [[fine art parody|exploitable]] format.

h4.External links
* "Jonathan Yeo - HM King Charles III":https://www.jonathanyeo.com/king-charles-iii
* "Know Your Meme: King Charles' Portrait":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/king-charles-portrait

She also frequently carries around a [[seal puppet|seal handpuppet]], which appears to display her emotions for her (similar to [[rabbit hair ornament|rabbit patch]] of [[bunny nun (diva)|bunny nun]]), as seen for example in post #7400010.

While not entirely confirmed, she appears to be the cousin of [[penguin keeper (diva)|Penguin keeper]] and [[polar bear keeper (diva)|Polar bear keeper]]. She is, however, definitely not their sister, as made evident in post #7597560.

title: nerf_dart
body:
Nerf darts are the catch-all term for any dart projectiles in the [[Hasbro]]-owned [[toy gun]] franchise Nerf. As many different Nerf guns utilise different types of ammunition, the term 'Nerf dart' specifically refers to small, cylindrical tubes topped with rubber ends that are designed to be a kid-friendly imitation of [[bullet|bullets]] for use in mock firefights.

The most universally recognised type of Nerf dart is the "Elite Dart":[https://nerf.fandom.com/wiki/Elite_Dart], a category of Nerf dart that was first released in 2012 coinciding with the launch of the N-Strike Elite series of Nerf toy guns. The standard Elite Dart is recognised by its [[blue]] cylindrical body and [[orange]] rubber tip, which has a hole inside it, likely to prevent choking if it were to be consumed. 

These Elite Darts were designed to be direct improvements to the previous 'Streamline Dart', with upgades to their range, aerodynamic stability, and general accuracy. However, they share largely the same flaws as their Streamline predecessor, primarily the hole in the front causing the air in front of the bullet, as it naturally encounters air resistance, to be dragged through the hollow body of the bullet, deforming and thus unbalancing the dart. 

Hasbro continues to manufacture these darts in spite of this design flaw in order to assure the safety of children who may consume the bullet accidentally, as despite their resemblance to conventional bullets fired by conventional firearms, Nerf ammunition, like the rest of the brand, is designed for non-lethal play instead of live fire combat. As such, their efficiency in both killing and as a general projectile are not prioritised.

The universality of the Elite Dart's design has resulted in many color variants being produced for Nerf toy weapons outside the initial N-Strike Series, such as the "GlowStrike Dart":[https://nerf.fandom.com/wiki/GlowStrike_Dart] (which would glow in the dark), the "Message Dart":[https://nerf.fandom.com/wiki/Message_Dart] (which was packaged with equipment that allowed for the writing of messages on the dart's body), and the "Star Wars Dart":[https://nerf.fandom.com/wiki/Star_Wars_Dart] (a collaboration dart produced for the [[Star Wars]] crossover line which came in [[red]] and [[blue]] colors signifying allegience to the First Order and the Resistance respectively).

title: shinn_asuka
body:
The protagonist of [[Gundam SEED Destiny]] - a young man who lost his family, victims of stray fire during one of [[Kira Yamato]]'s interventions, and chose to join ZAFT and enact his personal vengeance against the pilot of the [[Freedom Gundam]]. He takes to the controls of the [[Impulse Gundam]] - fittingly for his impulsive and enraged nature - in order to destroy Kira, but later abandons the suit and continues to fight his nemesis as the pilot of the [[Destiny Gundam]]. Both Shinn and Kira reconciled with each other at the end of the series. He eventually becomes the boyfriend of [[Lunamaria Hawke]].

In [[Gundam SEED Freedom]], he now serves as Kira's right-hand man, and becomes the designated pilot of the [[Immortal Justice Gundam]]. After the suit's destruction, he is once again, the pilot of the now upgraded [[Destiny Gundam Spec II]].

title: siyudi_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21050088

A derivative character of [[DIYUSI (cookie)|]], spawned from the popularity of DIYUSI's [[Cookie (touhou)|Cookie☆]] MADs. She has [[black hair]] in a [[high ponytail]] with a [[red bow|red]] [[hair bow]], [[red eyes]], [[white skin]] and wears a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]] with [[long sleeves]], a [[red ascot]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[suspender skirt]], and [[holding umbrella|holds]] a [[red umbrella|red]] [[closed umbrella]].

Whether or not she was accepted as a Cookie☆ character was controversial, as she was a completely original character with no attached voice drama. Over time, she has been slowly accepted as a part of DIYUSI's group as DIYUSI herself is barely a Touhou character anymore.

Wears a [[red dress]] and always has a [[triangle mouth]] and [[v-shaped eyes]]. Other characters can be sakenomi-ified but not very often. Sometimes has a similar treatment to [[yukkuri abuse]] but not very popular. Now paired with [[Hotaruda (cookie)|]], a similar minigirl version of [[Shinonome (cookie)|]].

title: hazuna_rio
body:
* !asset #20571296

The creator of [[Cookie (touhou)|Cookie]], usually depicted as [[Kirisame Marisa]] wearing a sheet printed with [[Shanghai Doll]] on the front. Known for sexually harassing the voice actors during its production, [[Hinase_(cookie)|]] in particular. Nicknamed "the root of all evil, the scum of humanity" by the Cookie community. He has since been doxxed and driven off the internet multiple times. 

He produced many Touhou animations and voice dramas before Cookie, even getting some fame with his "Able-Bodied" series. His moderate level of fame and and willingness to spend money is what allowed the original Cookie voice drama to have a total of 43 people involved. What was less known was that he was largely spending this money to meet underage girls by flying out and taking them to [[crab]] dinners and sexually harass them by touching them and showing them ero-doujins. Once the controversy began, the [[Manatsu no yo no inmu|Inmu]] and Touhou fans of NicoNicoDouga joined together to destroy all of his accounts on other sites and make sure he would never able to be to return to this day.

In fan art he is always drawn as a villain, tempting young girls with fame in exchange for sexual favors. Drawn with the other directors too, especially his successor, [[Taisa (cookie)|]].

title: joker_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21049341

Voice of [[Mizuhashi Parsee]] in [[Cookie (Touhou)|Nabe☆]], [[Murasa Minamitsu]] in Myorenji☆, [[Kirisame Marisa]] in Viet Cong☆, and Parsee in Gyudon☆. Identifiable by her [[parted bangs]] and very pointy ears. Due to Parsee's outfit having many colors, she is put on a [b]C[/b]yan [b]B[/b]ackground compared to the more common blue or green background. Has a very husky voice that led her to play the more tomboyish roles and famous for being a bigger lesbian than [[Mars (cookie)|]]. Her dedication to voice acting as an amateur led to her being the breakout star of Nabe☆. Named herself after Joker in [[Danzai no Maria]]. 

Started out initially unpopular as Nabe☆ was a failure. She was so unpopular that her unpopularity made her popular during the Unprecedented [[Majime-kun]] Boom of 2016, later getting grouped with [[Akanuma]], [[Ryuuga (cookie)|]], and [[Yuusaku (inmu)|]]. Her unrecognizableness became her biggest joke, with others just refering to her as "Who?" (taken from Akanuma) or "That mysterious elf". Frequent jokes about her being homeless because of how unpopular she is began to spread too. A video of Joker dancing was leaked in 2017, but unlike other doxxings this ended with the doxxer being harassed for having crossed a line. During Nabe☆ she adds a [[daikon]] into the nabe, so [[Reu Daikon]] began appearing alongside her, or her in a daikon costume herself. For some reason also has been paired with [[Suzu (cookie)|]], to the point where it SZJO is now both of their main ships.

title: xueyi_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
Playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]].

Judge of the Ten-Lords Commission, which presides over the jurisdiction of life and death on the Luofu. For years after her death, she inhabited a [[puppet]] body and returned to the world to fulfill her mission. 

She is the sister of [[Hanya (Honkai: Star Rail)|]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
"You are talking to a puppet. The Commission gifted me this body."

One of the judges of the Ten-Lords Commission. Of the four duties of a judge (detention, interrogation, incarceration, and punishment), she is charged with detention.

Holding iron chains and a Marasunder Awl in her hands, she tirelessly tracks down wanted criminals and subdues them.
[/expand]

title: mashiroma_zenima
body:
* !asset #21048714

Voice of [[Komeiji Satori]] in [[Cookie (Touhou)|Nabe☆]] and [[Nazrin]] and [[Yasaka Kanako]] in Myorenji☆. One of the better singers and an average artist so her popularity stayed stable even after Nabe☆ failed. A little after Nabe☆ was released it was discovered she had a boyfriend. Mentally ill Japanese users being who they are sent her negative comments. She attempted suicide but it failed and the negative comments stopped, and this incident has been largely buried since then.

Since mentioning in the voice drama that she uploaded utattemita videos as 銭麻 (Zenima), she became known for ガッツリ宣伝 ([[holding sign|adamant ad-pushing]]). This spawned the sub-meme of her as a pushy [[nun]] trying to get people to convert. Another joke was her line "Ah, Koishi" which through her subpar microphone sounded like a [[trumpet|ZUNpet]] which then gets remixed in the music MADs.

title: sogiita_gunha
body:
A [[Toaru Majutsu no Index]] character introduced in Volume SS2, Gunha is Academy City's 7th ranked Level 5, and a Gemstone (a natural-born esper, as opposed to one that was raised through Academy City's education system). Nicknamed Attack Crash (念動砲弾 [i]Nendou Houdan[/i], lit. Telekinetic Shell) after his signature attack. 

Despite being the 7th ranked, lowest among the Level 5s, he is extraordinarily powerful, and could possibly be ranked as high as number one - however, the full extent of his abilities is unknown, and not even he is fully aware of how his powers work, instead describing them as "guts". 

Based on hero stereotypes, he is hard headed, hot blooded, and has a strong sense of justice, even more than [[Kamijou Touma]].

Often depicted wearing a [[headband]] and a T-shirt with the [[Rising Sun Flag]] on it.

h4. External links

* "Toaru Majutsu no Index Wiki: Sogiita Gunha":http://toarumajutsunoindex.wikia.com/wiki/Sogiita_Gunha

title: m&m_(mickey_and_mackey)
body:
M&M is an illustrator duo that consisted of Mickey (ミッキー), taking charge of coloring, and Mackey (マッキー), drawing orignal (line)art.

They were working for the company [i][[Atelier Kaguya]][/i], a Japanese eroge maker. They mainly draw illustrations for the games of "Team Heartbeat", a sub-division of the company A-Kaguya, and has been doing so since 2003. They're now working for Astronauts, another adult game brand.

They were originally a doujin circle that consisted of four people: Mickey, Mackey, E.T and ODE.

title: yuzuyu_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21031879
* !asset #21031880

Voice of [[Koakuma]] and [[Mystia Lorelei]] and [[nakaba_(nkbaaa)|artist]] in the original [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆]]. While sometimes treated as two separate characters, they almost never interact so this wiki chooses to combine them. Also called Fucking Fat-aneki based on a followup video by [[Hazuna Rio]] so she became associated with [[sumo]] wrestling. 

Running jokes include her flapping her arms, asking for hot water, her distinctive wave greeting, and constantly fleeing as Mystia.

title: nadeko_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21031646
* !asset #21031663

Voice of [[Rumia]] and [[Reiuji Utsuho]] in the original [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆]], and one of the participating artists. Usually considered the same person unlike Yamin and Cirno or Hinase and DIYUSI. Originally just meant to be an artist, she was going to fill in for Reimu if [[Reu (cookie)|]] wasn't available, but later got assigned to Rumia and Okuu. According to her, [[Hazuna Rio]] touched her thighs but didn't go further than that. 

Also considered to be fairly bad at voice acting and drawing, but people were sympathetic to her after hearing about her experience. Generally depicted as a messy or absentminded character. Her [[is that so|so~nanoka]] line as Rumia got compared to the so~dayo line from [[Miura Daisenpai]], so fans began drawing them together. While she is sometimes still seen with [[DIYUSI (cookie)|]] and [[Cirno (cookie)|]], these appearances have fallen off as those two became more derivative characters.

title: macota_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21031790
* !asset #21031799
* !asset #21031798 

Voice of [[Kazami Yuuka]], [[Remilia Scarlet]], and [[Hong Meiling]] in the original [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆]]. Because of how quickly she spoke her lines, she's also called the Fast Talking Oba-san, despite being the same age as [[Uzuki (cookie)|]].  Joined the voice drama at [[Hinase (cookie)|]]'s encouragement, but not as [[makokokokokoko|an artist]]. Whether or not she was harassed by [[Hazuna Rio]] is unknown. 

While initially depicted a sadist similar to Yuuka, this characterization fell away after a time and she mostly became a guardian character similar to [[Kanna (cookie)|]]. Mostly depicted as Yuuka, sometimes as the [[chibi]] Remilia, but almost never as Meiling anymore.

title: genpatsu_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21031526
* !asset #21031550: [[tsurikichi obasan]]

Voice of [[Izayoi Sakuya]] in the original [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆]]. Also called Yukimura Rio, from [[Sanada Yukimura (sengoku_basara)|]]. While initially as popular as [[Uzuki (cookie)|]], her fame declined as time went on as her audio material wasn't good for remixing. She was also not involved in the controversy, so there was nothing on that front. However, a Futaba channel thread photoshopped her on the front of a fishing magazine and from thenceforth she became linking with fishing.

Unlike other VAs, her name is fan given. She was very outspoken against nuclear power plants and so she was dubbed Nuclear Power Sister, or Genpatsu-aneki for short. Other than her fishing and nuclear power opinions, she mostly appears as a normal Sakuya.

title: a_mimir_(meme)
body:
Spanish babytalk mispronunciation of the phrase "A Dormir" ("Time to sleep") that grew popular in the social media sites like Twitter, Reddit, and Tumblr after the Japanese artist [[moricky]] responded to a fan using the phrase.

On June 6th 2020, [[moricky]] shared a drawing on twitter of a little black kitten tucked on a bed. An hour later the user "Brujita Verde" responded to the drawing with the phrase, prompting the artist to ask what it meant and using the phrase after it was explained to her  A few days later on June 15th, 2020, the artist shared a second drawing of a little bear and a white kitten tucked on a bed alongside the phrase "Two Mimir", mistakenly thinking that the original phrase meant a tiny creature called Mimir.

title: chiibou_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21031387 
* !asset #21031388

[[Hinase (cookie)|]]'s mother, usually depicted as [[Shinki (touhou)|]] from the [[touhou (pc-98)|PC-98 games]] as Hinase played Alice. Unlike other [[Cookie (touhou)|]] characters, she never appeared in a voice drama. Her Twitter profile picture was a [[chick]], where she made tweets criticizing Prime Minister [[Abe Shinzou]] and supporting left-wing policies. She would later delete her account when the unwanted attention became too much.

Received a minor boost in popularity in 2022 following the "assassination of Shinzo Abe":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assassination_of_Shinzo_Abe] and a coincendental boost in [[Creaf (cookie)|]]'s popularity, who was known for making right-wing statements.

title: diyusi_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21031333

Hinase Haruka as [[Daiyousei]] in the original [[cookie (touhou)|Cookie☆]]. Typically seen with [[traffic baton]], [[high-visibility vest]], and [[road sign]]s. She has a [[high ponytail|ponytail]] instead of a sidetail, pale or [[white skin]], and almost always has her eyes closed.

Originally an unimportant character, getting overshadowed by [[Cirno (cookie)|]] and [[Nadeko (cookie)|]]. This began to change in 2014 when a BB theater of her directing traffic became a little popular. Then in 2017, [[OFFSide: DIYUSI]] began and she became one of the most popular characters in the entire fandom. Her character is almost entirely defined from MADs and fan videos, separate from the original voice drama and anything about Hinase. This would later cause Cirno to drift too, becoming the Security Guard to match DIYUSI's Crossing Guard. She even received her own derivative character in [[SIYUDI (cookie)|]].

title: hinase_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21031045
* !asset #21031170: [[shiren_(monochrome_structure)|alternate design]]
* !post #5022850: [[hinase_haruka|self portrait]]

Voice actress of [[Alice Margatroid]] and Daiyousei in the original [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆]], however [[DIYUSI (Cookie)|]] has since become a completely separate character that should be tagged independently. Usually drawn with [[orange hair]], [[red eyes]], a [[pink hairband]], [[pink necktie]], and [[pink sash]] all with [[frilled hairband|very]] [[frilled necktie|triangular]] [[frilled sash|frills]]. 

Originally also called ALC, but the ensuing Alices led to her mostly being referred to by her name. Convinced her friend [[Macota (cookie)|]] to join the voice drama. While [[Reu (cookie)|]] and [[Uzuki (cookie)|]]'s voice acting was bad, her acting was decent so she received less criticism in the initial wave of controversy. Once news broke of how badly [[Hazuna Rio]] sexually harassed her, she received the most defense of all the actresses. She confirmed it never went beyond harassment so nothing illegal was done. 

As one of the main characters of Cookie, her popularity has continued strong for the entire fandom with several running jokes:
* Fucking big teacup: An unusually large teacup that she holds for a frame in the voice drama.
* The [[stone]]: A small rock from a MAD that went viral.
* The sickle: The [[Bois de Justice]] from [[Dies Irae]]. A battle MAD that went viral had her use it. Sometimes transferred to DIYUSI as well.
* [[Yandere|Crazy psycopath]]: Depicting her to be jealous of Reu and Uzuki's relationship.
* [[Chiibou (cookie)|]]: Hinase's actual mother.
other_names: 怒りの日の奏者と化したALC

title: uzuki_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21030698
* !asset #21030951: Briefly lived twitter trend

Voice of [[Kirisame Marisa]] in the original [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆]]. Distinguishable by having her [[side braid]] on her right side of her head with a [[pink bow|pink]] [[hair bow|bow]], [[yellow eyes]], and her [[red-framed eyewear|red]] [[glasses]]. Also called Marina (her real name). Essentially the main character of Cookie, she was the one to recruit other members like [[Reu (cookie)|]] and [[Yamin (cookie)|]], the first criticized for her acting, and the first to expose [[Hazuna Rio]] causing the ensuing drama. Left the internet in 2011, but still in contact with Reu.

Usually appears as the main character in MADs due to the large amount of material she recorded. Almost all Marisas are called UDKs in reference to her, partially because her disappearance meant that the others had to live up to her. 

She spawned numerous running jokes:
* "Aaaaaaaaaah, wasureteta!" (Aaaaaaaaaah, I forgot!): Her line when she realized to forgot to reciprocate Alice's gift for Valentine's day.
* [[Van Houten]] cocoa: What she says makes Alice's brownies good.
* Tororo [[soba]] press conference: Her breakdown on a livestream when she was ranting about malicious comments sounded like she was slurping noodles.
* Starry Sky: A poem she wrote. See post #4488363
* Art college ball: A painting she made when applying to art school. Usually appears in the background of other images.
* !asset #21030926
* Assassin UDK: Her [[black hoodie|black]] and [[white hoodie|white]] [[striped hoodie]] she wore during a stream
* Comiket UDK: A possible photo of her as [[Usami Renko]] at Comiket. Whether or not it is actually her is unknown.
* Iwana / Charfish: A soramimi pun during one of her livestreams.

title: eisen_(sousou_no_frieren)
body:
Eisen is a Dwarf and the Warrior of the Hero Party, alongside [[Heiter|Priest Heiter]], [[Frieren|Mage Frieren]], and [[himmel (sousou no frieren)|Hero Himmel]].

He would eventually take in a [[aged down|young]] [[Stark (sousou no frieren)|]] as his apprentice, before parting ways after an argument that left Stark with a large [[scar on forehead|scar on his forehead]] and Eisen ashamed that he lost control of himself.

Eisen is a male Dwarf with [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] and a [[long beard]] covering his mouth. He usually has either [[grey eyes|grey]] or [[black eyes]] depending on how they're drawn. He has [[shoulder armor]] over his [[red cloak]] and that he wears over his body and [[horned helmet]] that he always wears. He uses a large [[battle axe]] as a weapon.

title: kyoshinhei
body:
The "God Warrior" in [[Kaze no Tani no Nausicaa]], a bioweapon created by the ancients. It is a giant humanoid with a dome-shaped skull and lanky body, whose primary armament is an immensely powerful energy beam fired from its mouth.

The movie version was little more than a disintegrating mess, being "born" prematurely and collapsing after firing its beam. The manga kyoshinhei could fly using luminous 'wings' and emitted a 'poisonous light' that sickened and eventually killed anyone who remained near it. This version was adopted by [[Nausicaa]] and named [[Ohma]].

h4. External links

* "Japanese Wikipedia page on the [i]Kyoshinhei[/i]":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B7%A8%E7%A5%9E%E5%85%B5

title: eve_no_jikan
body:
A 2008 six episode original net animation by Yashuhiro Yoshiura, it was converted into a full length movie in 2010.

In the not too distant future androids have come into common usage. [[Sakisaka Rikuo]], who has taken robots for granted for his entire life, one day discovers that [[Sammy (eve no jikan)|]], his home android, has been acting independently and coming and going on her own. He finds a strange phrase recorded in her activity log, "Are you enjoying the Time of Eve?". He, along with his friend [[Masaki Masakazu]], traces Sammy's movements and finds an unusual cafe, "The Time of Eve". [[Nagi (eve no jikan)|]], the waitress, informs them that the cafe's main rule is to not discriminate between humans and androids. Within the cafe androids do not display their status rings, and, when patrons depart, the door is automatically locked for two minutes to prevent someone from following them to discover their true nature.

title: sound_effect_request
body:
Sound effect text appears untranslated even though the post may otherwise be [[translated]]. Sound effects are often skipped because they can be inferred from context, ambiguous, and are less critical to understanding. It's also common when a post's translation is taken from another, hard-translated source (such as a manga scanlation aggregator).

Sound effects can be translated in a number of ways. For example, ゴゴゴゴ could be translated as:

* *rumbling* <tn>What the sound effect represents (a verb or an adjective)</tn>
* gogogogo <tn>A romanization of the katakana that preserves the reading</tn>
* brbrbrbr <tn>How the sound effect might be spoken in English</tn>

You can include more than one translation to help different kinds of readers.

Keep in mind that "Japanese sound effects aren't always sounds":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_sound_symbolism] and may represent non-auditory senses like "damp", "stealthily", "foolishy", "plump", and "fluffy".

h1. Translation resources

Translating sound effects doesn't require much Japanese proficiency. Please feel free to try it!
You can usually just look up the katakana and pick the meaning that fits best.

* "The JADED Network: SFX Dictionary":[http://thejadednetwork.com/thejadednetwork.com/sfx/] (HTTPS not supported)
* "Jan Mitsuko: Japanese SFX Database":[https://www.janmitsuko.cash/resources/translation-resources/japanese-sfx-database/]
* "English Wiktionary":[https://en.wiktionary.org/]
* "Japanese Wiktionary":[https://ja.wiktionary.org/]

Cassiopeia is a [[constellation]] located in the Northern celestial hemisphere. It is named after the queen Cassiopeia, mother of Andromeda, in Greek mythology. Its brightest star is Schedar.

Cassiopeia is an easily recognizable constellation. Its five bright stars form a slightly irregular letter W (or M).

title: tomoki_nakamoto
body:
[[Full Service (Mazjojo)|Full Service]] main and playable character.

A workaholic accountant who works at Schwarz Bank. He generally seems uninterested in anything other than his work. While sometimes snarky and dense about relationships between people, it seems he does genuinely want to have a romantic relationship.

title: sota_kobayashi
body:
[[Full Service (Mazjojo)|Full Service]] character.

A young, cheerful, and hyperactive masseur. He studies at Morningwood University during the day and works as a masseur for Full Service Spa at night. After his father abandoned them years ago, Sota became the pri- mary breadwinner of his family, car- ing for his sick mother and providing for his numerous younger siblings. He takes his job at Full Service very seriously and is willing to do any- thing to try to improve as a masseur and make more cash.

title: vivian_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21018537

Voice of [[Saigyouji Yuyuko]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S3]]. Notable for being Chinese, originally from Shanghai but living in Tokyo. To distinguish her, the [[People's Republic of China flag]] is drawn on her hat instead of the usual spiral. 

One of the better voice actresses, often said to be better at Japanese than most of the native speakers causing her to win the audition. Mostly appears as a Yuyuko stand-in, paired with [[Eska (cookie)|]] as the Youmu stand-in. Still active on "BiliBili":[https://space.bilibili.com/1433840/] as a [[virtual youtuber]].

title: eska_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21018473
Voice of [[Konpaku Youmu]] in [[cookie (touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S3]] and Kasu☆. Known for being one of the youngest of the voice actresses. While initially mildly popular, her fame waned as time went on and was replaced by the RIM family, UDK family, and ALC faction.

One frame of her running with a [[wheel o feet]] and swinging her [[katana]]s with [[afterimage]]s making it look like she had 6 arms became popular. Other than that, she is paired with [[Asatsuki (cookie)|]] usually as the younger companion.

title: sakuranbou_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21018374

Voice of [[Alice Margatroid]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S3]]. Almost always drawn as [[muscular female|extremely muscular]] because of the MMD model she used. 

Despite her appearance, she is usually depicted as the most innocent of all of the Alices, blushing or hiding from anything lewd due to her lines in the voice drama. Sometimes seen as a sparring partner for [[Kanna (cookie)|]] or interested in [[Rei (cookie)|]]-kun, but is normal other than that.

title: yuwo_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21018364

Voice of [[Shameimaru Aya]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S3]] and [[Saigyouji Yuyuko]] in Halloween☆. Almost exclusively drawn as Aya because of how quickly she deleted her personal accounts, leading to her nickname as "Cookie's fastest woman".

Her speed left almost nothing for running jokes, so she is mostly just a stand-in for Aya.

title: rei_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21018311 

Voice of [[Kirisame Marisa]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S3]] and [[Onozuka Komachi]] in Halloween☆. Typically portrayed in her kaoru式 MMD model which is based on Forbidden Scrollery's Marisa, wearing a [[black coat]] with [[buttons]], [[black gloves]], a [[petticoat]], and a [[purple bow|purple]] [[hair bow]]. Extremely commonly depicted as a [[genderswap (ftm)|male]] [[crossdressing]] [[otoko no ko]] due to her husky voice.

Despite having a similar voice to [[Azusa (cookie)|]] and [[Mars (cookie)|]], she is far worse at singing which became popular in its own way. 

Because of how often Rei is depicted as male, identifying their gender solely based on the image can be difficult or impossible. If the artist has tagged the image or written commentary with RIくん or RI君, then they are a male. Other hints can be: [[Sananana (cookie)|]] creeping on them, the artist drawing Rei as male in previous images, or the comments on the image. If there is absolutely no indication of Rei being male, then tag them as female.

title: sananana_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21018214
* !asset #21018215

Voice of [[Hakurei Reimu]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S3]] and [[Komeiji Koishi]] in Nabe☆. Drawn with [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] and [[yellow eyes]]. Very often drawn as a [[magical girl]] wearing a pink version of Reimu's clothes or as an [[office lady]]. Very rarely drawn with [[long hair]] and long [[sidelocks]]. The number 3777 can be shortened to her name, so sometimes appears too.

While initially unpopular, the 2014 boom of the RIM Family of her, [[Benikurage (cookie)|]], [[Kanna (cookie)|]], [[Reu (cookie)|]], and [[Yamin (cookie)|]] gradually increased her standing. This led to her characterization in fan art and media to be almost entirely disconnected from both her appearance in the voice dramas and any information about her real life.

A false rumor of her being 27 years old stuck and led her to being depicted as an embarrassing woman who dresses up in costumes and pretends to be a high-schooler to fit in with the other voice actresses. This was perpetuated by her saying she was "in her 20s" and doing an audio recording of a middle-schooler magical girl/idol. Another copypasta had her sexually attracted to dolphins, particularly [[Kairu the Dolphin]] of [[Microsoft Office]]. Her age also means she is drawn with [[pubic hair]] and [[armpit hair]] which later contributed to [[Shiromiya Rei]]'s association. Also commonly paired with [[Rei (cookie)|]]-kun, as a sort of [[onee-shota]] relationship.

title: suzuki_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21018197

A [[NEET]] from Toyohashi who threatened to burn [[Kanna (cookie)|]] alive for incorrectly portraying [[Hakurei Reimu]]. 

For more information: https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2014-06-16/police-arrest-man-who-threatens-woman-because-of-touhou-project-voice-over/.75608

title: kochiko_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21018145

Voice of [[Koakuma]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S2]]. According to the comments at the time, she had a "fat voice" so is usually drawn [[plump]] or [[fat]]. Compounded by when she first introduced herself, people thought she called herself "Pojiko". 

Despite her knowing of being called fat, she decided not to care and continue releasing singing videos. This gained her respected as a heroic and fearless voice actress. Other than that, she is drawn as a companion to the more generic [[Yuzuyu (cookie)|]]'s Koakuma, sometimes with [[fake wings]] on a [[hairband]].

title: yuno_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21018108

Voice of [[Flandre Scarlet]] in [[cookie (touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S2]]. Her and [[Sakura (cookie)|]]'s stuffy voices have them called the Nose Celebrity Sisters. Often called Sakura "Sakura-oneesama".  

One of the youngest voice actresses being around 13 years old, so her bad acting and singing is usually forgiven. She nicknamed herself YUNO-kun, which later gave rise to [[Rei (cookie)|]] being given the same suffix after she overshadowed Yuno.

title: sakura_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21018070

Voice of [[Remilia Scarlet]] in [[cookie (touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S2]]. Her and [[Yuno (cookie)|]]'s stuffy voices have them called the Nose Celebrity Sisters. Disappeared from the internet after she got married and had children.

While normally an unremarkable member of the cast, one particular image has single-handedly kept her popular:
* !asset #21018090
This is the most viewed, most parodied, and most commented Cookie image on the entirety of NicoSeiga. Nicknamed Deri-Sakura, this extremely poorly drawn image has become Sakura's entire legacy. It is commonly hidden in the background of other Cookie images or has other characters posing the same way. Sometimes it is drawn as Sakura's sister or a creation of hers that has come to life.

title: aika_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21018027
* !asset #21018029

Voice of [[Izayoi Sakuya]] in [[cookie (touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S2]] and [[Inaba Tewi]] in Cookie☆☆ S3. Drawn with purple-ish hair as Sakuya, but not always.

Had one of the calmest reactions to her Cookie popularity spike and stayed on relatively good terms with the rest of the cast including [[Taisa (cookie)|]]. Mostly is drawn as a companion to the other Sakuyas or as the Tewi to [[Hisui (cookie)|]]'s Reisen.

title: kurikinton_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21018017

Voice of [[Cirno]] in [[cookie (touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S2]]. No notable deviations from Cirno's default appearance.

While her acting was subpar, she was a [[mua_(tatarauramesiya)|far better artist]]. She also had a stalker, [[Jyu (cookie)|]]. Another voice actor named [[ANNYUI (cookie)|]] was thought to have similar voice, so they are drawn together.

title: kanna_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21017868
* !asset #21017904

Voice of [[Hakurei Reimu]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S2]]. Drawn with [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes|eyes]], with her distinct [b]~[/b] shaped [[blush]]es. Her stated height is 172cm, so she is drawn taller and with [[large breasts|larger breasts]] than the other Reimus. Her angry mother-like voice and attitude also has her appear as the mom figure to [[Yamin (cookie)|]] and [[Benikurage (cookie)|]]. Her voice also has her drawn as the most combative Reimu, with a [[dark persona]] that she fights.

She initially hated the attention that Cookie gave her, especially after her stalker [[Suzuki (cookie)|]] made national headlines when he was arrested for threatening to burn her alive. However, she warmed back up to Cookie after a few years, and has since become an [[Indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber]] in a [[miko]] costume. 

h4. External Links
* Her channel: https://www.youtube.com/@KANNA_CH

title: taisa_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21017724
* !asset #21017725
* !asset #21017726
* !asset #21017727

Director of the [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆☆ trilogy]], voicing [[Patchouli Knowledge]], [[Alice Margatroid]], [[Yakumo Yukari]], and [[Yagokoro Eirin]] but mostly appears in fan art as Patchouli or Alice. Almost always drawn [[smoking]] a [[cigarette]] and with [[sharp teeth]] across all her appearances. Never wears a hat as Patchouli, a [[collared capelet]] and no frills as Alice. Rarely associated with [[tentacles]] too.

Known for being [[yuri|in a relationship]] with [[Mars (Cookie)|]] after they met at voice acting school. Usually drawn as [[flat chest|flat]] compared to Mars. In fanworks, she appears as an unscrupulous yet charismatic director who is willing to sell the voice actors for fame.

title: sponge_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21017820

Voice of [[Morichika Rinnosuke]] in [[cookie (touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S1]], one of the very few male voice actors.

Considered one of the best voice actors, but mostly used as a stand-in for Rinnosuke when needed.

title: paseri_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21017793

Voice of [[Kochiya Sanae]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S1]]. Typically drawn with [[facepaint|facepainted]] [[cross]] marks resembling ＋⌒o⌒＋, an emoji for Suwako, as in the fan MMD video.

One of the more unimportant characters, mostly being used as a stand-in for Sanae. Sometimes drawn as a daycare worker or kindergarten teacher.

title: ryuuga_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21017783

Voice of [[Izayoi Sakuya]] in [[cookie (touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S1]]. Usually drawn with [[purple hair]] and [[glasses]] of some color.

Despite appearing in one of the most popular voice dramas, she lacks running jokes or information. This lack of public interest has been compared to [[Majime-kun]], as her one gag.

title: kirara_jump
body:
[i]"Any anime where they jump in the OP is a god-tier anime."[/i] -- [[Yamada Ryo]], [i][[Bocchi the Rock!]][/i]

A jumping scene common in the openings of animated adaptations of [i][[Manga Time Kirara]][/i] manga. The scene usually involves the main cast (typically a cast of 3 or 4) [[holding hands]] and jumping against a [[blue sky]], with each character's primary traits displayed in their jumping style.

title: benikurage_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21017649

Voice of [[Hakurei Reimu]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S1]]. Has [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]] with a noticeable [[parted bangs|center part]]. Mostly seen with her [[orange scarf|orange]] and [[red scarf|red]] [[striped scarf]] and [[red mittens]]. In real life she has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]]. Is probably [[Kakinota Neina]] too.

Since mentioning in some of her streams that her father tried to put a stray [[cat]] as part of nabe and that she burned the Quran (if these statements are true is unknown), fans have associated her with cats and Islamism. She has has a minor running joke of having a coating on her tongue. 

Typically portrayed in the [[Forbidden Scrollery]] style MMD model by Montecore.

title: leina_(queen's_blade)
body:
[b]Leina[/b] (レイナ) is a [[Queen's Blade]] character and the main character of the OVA anime. Voiced by [[Kawasumi Ayako]], designed by [[Hisayuki Hirokazu]]. A heir apparent of the noble Vance family. She is the older sister of [[Elina (queen's blade)|]] and half younger sister of [[Claudette (queen's blade)|]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]], and wears metal rings in her braids. She fights with a sword and shield. In [[Queen's Blade Unlimited]], her hair and bangs were [[long hair|noticeably lengthened]].

Leina's (Exiled Warrior) combat book: pool #767 

h4. Variations 

* [[exiled_warrior_leina|Leina (Exiled Warrior)]]
* [[phantom_warrior_leina|Leina (Phantom Warrior)]]
* [[leina_(queen's_blade_unlimited)|Leina (Queen's Blade Unlimited)]]

title: journey_-_taiko_arabia_hantou_de_no_kiseki_to_tatakai_no_monogatari
body: [b]The Journey[/b] is a 2021 a anime movie made by Toei Animation. A co-production between Japan and Saudi Arabia, the anime is a loose adaptation of a famous moment in [[Islam]], [i]The Year of the Elephant,[/i] when Abraha of the Aksumite kingdom attempted to invade the city of Mecca and destroy the [[Kaaba]]. The movie follows Aus, a former thief turned potter, who joins a small army to defend his home from Abraha's army.
other_names: ジャーニー_太古アラビア半島での奇跡と戦いの物語

title: kikou-kai_galient
body:
機甲界ガリアン ([b][i]Kikou-Kai Galient[/i][/b] / [i]Kikōkai Garian[/i]), also known as [b][i]Panzer World Galient[/i][/b], is a 1984 [[Japan]]ese [[science_fiction|sci-fi]] and [[fantasy]] anime [[super robot]] show focusing on ancient super technology [[mecha]]s in a [[medieval]]-looking planet.

The anime TV series was produced by [[Sunrise (company)]]. It was broadcast on [[nippon_tv|Nippon Television]] from October 5, 1984 to March 29, 1985.

The "show's opening":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8UjsH5xCC1E and "ending":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kNNNjLvyiOE musical themes were composed and performed by EUROX, a Japanese progressive rock band formed in 1984 in Tokyo, Japan. 

h4.Characters

* [[Jordy Volder]] / Joedy-Vorder / JoJo
* [[Chururu]] / Churuee

* [[azubes_(galient)|Azubes]]

* [[Hilmuka]]  / Hilmocha


* [[Mardal]] / Mardoul
* [[Hei Schaldat]] / Schaltat / High-Schultatte

h4.Mechas

(These giant mechs are called 機甲兵, Kikou-hei / Panzer Swords)

* [[Galient]], Panzer Sword
** [[Assault Galient]]
* [[Skartz]] / Skurts, Panzer Hunter
* [[Zauel]] / Zuwel, Panzer Hunter
* [[Wingal]], Panzer Gust
* [[Wingal Zee]], Panzer Gust Leader
* [[Twingal]], Panzer Gust Carrier
* [[Promaxis]], Panzer Trampler
* [[Promaxis Zee]], Panzer Trampler Leader

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panzer_World_Galient

* [[Panzer Paladin]] - A recent [[video game]] heavily inspired by this series.

A university student from Lungmen and a member of [[Lee (Arknights)|]]'s Detective Agency with [[Aak_(Arknights)|Aak]] and [[Hung_(Arknights)|Hung]]. She is serving Rhodes Island from the first batch of employees hired under a secret Lungmen-Rhodes Island commercial agreement. A practitioner of Wing Chun martial arts, which she often uses on the battlefield.

Her motif is based on [[Tiger girl|tigers]].

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Kobayashi Yuu]].

title: sports_bra
body:
A sports bra is basically a tight-fitting [[tank top]] with the bottom half [[crop top|cut off]], exposing the [[midriff]]. Despite its name, it is typically not considered [[underwear]]. It is intended for wear during vigorous exercise that might cause the [[breasts]] to move uncomfortably or excessively, preventing discomfort and [[wardrobe_malfunction|potential embarrassment]] during exercise.

title: cross-shaped_pupils
body:
When a character's pupils are shaped like a + or †.

Do not confuse with [[+ +]] or [[x x]], which are specifically for eyes that shine in excitement or "dead eyes" respectively. Cross-shaped pupils are for characters with default/natural + or † pupils.

h4. See also

* [[x-shaped pupils]]
* [[Symbol-shaped pupils]]

title: star-shaped_pupils
body:
When a character's pupils are shaped like a [[star (symbol)|star]]. This tag is only for when the entire pupil is shaped like a star, use [[star in eye]] for cases where there is a star present inside the eyes.

When indicating eyes lighting up in excitement, use [[+ +]] instead.

Do not confuse for [[cross-shaped pupils]] or [[diamond-shaped pupils]].

h4. See also
* [[star in eye]]
* [[+ +]]
* [[heart-shaped pupils]]

* [[flower-shaped pupils]]

* [[x-shaped pupils]]

title: lamellar_armor
body:
[[Armor]] made from small perforated rectangular plates (lamellae) of metal, leather or bone laced into horizontal rows. Lamellar armor was used over a wide range of time periods in Central Asia, Eastern Asia (especially in China, Japan, Mongolia, and Tibet), Western Asia, and Eastern Europe.

Do not confuse with [[scale armor]]; lamellar armor is usually not attached to a leather backing (although, like most types of armor, it is typically worn over a padded undergarment).

h4. See also
* [[Scale armor]]
* [[Chainmail]]
* [[List of armor]]

title: touch_grass_(meme)
body:
Touch Grass, or Touch Some Grass, is a popular online insult and alternative way of telling someone to "go outside," implying they're spending too much time online and it's affecting their wellbeing. title: tower_bridge_(london)
body:
An iconic Victorian [[gothic_architecture|Gothic]] bridge crossing the River Thames in [[London]], England. It has two tower sections connected by two sets of pedestrian walkways as well as having the "bascule":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bascule_bridge road deck, which can be raised to allow river traffic to pass through. It was named after the nearby Tower of London.

It played an important role in publicizing the [[2012 Summer Olympics]].

h4. See also

* "Tower Bridge Exhibition":http://www.towerbridge.org.uk/TBE/EN/
* Wikipedia: "Tower Bridge":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tower_Bridge
* Youtube: "Tower Bridge - London UK":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LYJYGr-pm78
* Vimeo: "Building Tower Bridge":http://vimeo.com/16024009

title: uenoyama_ritsuka
body:
A main character in [[Given]]. A skilled guitarist who initially finds music a chore, Ritsuka meets [[Satou Mafuyu|Mafuyu]] whom he's impressed by his singing, leading to the formation of the band - Given. Though often blunt and critical, Ritsuka cares deeply for his friends and teammates, and his journey with Given leads him to rediscover his passion for music and explore his own emotions.

title: satou_mafuyu

body:
[[katana|Japanese sword]] mountings and fittings.

h5. Hilt and blade components
* [[tsuka (handle)|Tsuka]] (柄): sword handle.
** [[kashira (pommel)|Kashira]] (頭): end cap (pommel) on the end of the [i]tsuka[/i].
*** [b]Shitodome[/b] (鵐目): small metal collars in the [i]kashira[/i] and/or [i]kurigata[/i].
** [b]Samegawa[/b] (鮫皮): ray or shark skin used to cover the bare wooden handle.
*** [[Same-hada]] (鮫肌): literally the pattern of the ray skin (of [i]samegawa[/i]).
** [b]Tsukamaki[/b] (柄巻): way (pattern) of wrapping [i]tsuka-ito[/i] around the [i]tsuka[/i] ("see reference":https://www.touken-world.jp/tips/9966/#:~:text=柄巻の種類).
*** [[Tsuka-ito]] (柄糸): leather straps or woven cord used in the [i]tsukamaki[/i].
** [b]Mekugi[/b] (目釘): peg(s) for securing the handle to the blade.
*** [b]Mekugi-ana[/b] (目釘穴): hole(s) for the [i]mekugi[/i].
** [[Menuki]] (目貫): decorative metal fittings for the [i]tsuka[/i] (generally underneath the [i]tsukamaki[/i]; "see reference":https://www.touken-world.jp/tips/35070/).
** [[fuchi (hilt)|Fuchi]] (縁): hilt collar between the [i]tsuka[/i] and the [i]tsuba[/i].
* [[tsuba (guard)|Tsuba]] (鐔 or 鍔): sword guard.
** [b]Seppa[/b] (切羽): washers or spacers above and below the [i]tsuba[/i] to tighten the fittings.
* [[Habaki]] (鎺): blade collar.

h5. Scabbard components
* [[Saya (scabbard)|Saya]] (鞘): sword scabbard.
** [[Koiguchi]] (鯉口): mouth of the [i]saya[/i] or its fitting.
** [[Kurigata]] (栗形): [i]saya[/i] fitting for attaching the [i]sageo[/i].
*** [[Sageo]] (下げ緒): cord used for tying the [i]saya[/i] to the obi.
** [b]Kaeritsuno[/b] (返角): hook-shaped fitting used to lock the [i]saya[/i] to the obi while drawing.
** [[Kojiri]] (鐺): end cap on the end of the scabbard.
* [b]Kogai[/b] (笄): spike for hair and knot arrangements carried in a pocket of the [i]saya[/i], often paired with [i]kozuka[/i] ("see reference":https://www.touken-world.jp/wp/wp-content/themes/wp-templ/three-things/image/top/img-three-things-explanation.jpg).
* [b]Kozuka[/b] (小柄): decorated utility knife carried in a pocket of the [i]saya[/i], often paired with [i]kogai[/i] ("see reference":https://www.touken-world.jp/wp/wp-content/themes/wp-templ/three-things/image/top/img-three-things-explanation.jpg).

h4. External links
* "Touken World (JP): Koshirae part names":https://www.touken-world.jp/tips/10388/
* "Wikipedia: Koshirae":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_sword_mountings 
* "Wikipedia: Koshirae components (image)":https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/a/aa/Katana_%28common_shema%29.png

title: infinity_mirror
body:
A phenomenon that occurs when two identical mirrors are set up parallel to each other, creating the illusion of an infinitely long tunnel.
It is often depicted in media as a source of paranormal activity.

title: koishi_day
body: A day to celebrate [[Komeiji Koishi]] from [[Touhou]]. The 14th of May is considered Koishi day because the numbers 5-14 can be read as go-i-shi [五一四] (ko-i-shi). There is also an additional day dedicated to Koishi set to the 14th of June. The numbers 6-1-4 can be read as mu-i-shi which are the prefix for muishiki meaning "unconscious" or "unconsciousness". h4. See also * [[Cirno Day]] (9th September) * [[Kaguya Day]] (8th September) * [[Nazrin Day]] (20th July) * [[Satori Day]] (10th March) * [[Sekibanki Day]] (6th June) * [[SatoKoi day]]

title: androgyne_symbol
body:
The ⚨ symbol.

A mix of the [[mars symbol|mars]] (♂) and [[venus symbol|venus]] (♀) symbols.

It can be used to refer to characters that have an [[androgynous]] appearance, characters that are intersex/hermaphrodite/[[futanari]], or characters with a non-binary gender identity.

It can be shown pointing in any direction, and the direction is sometimes used to distinguish androgyne and intersex.

Closely related to and commonly interchanged with with the [[male-female symbol]] (⚥). Distinctly separate and not to be confused with the [[transgender symbol]] (⚧).

It swaps characters' roles around, most notably placing Chara and Asriel in Sans and Payrus' place.

It has since been combined with other popular AUs like [[Underfell]] and [[Underswap]].

title: volleyball
body:
A team sport in which two teams of six players are separated by a [[volleyball net]]. Each team tries to score points by grounding a ball on the other team's court under organized rules. It may be played on grass, sand, snow, or on an indoor court such as in a [[gym]].

[[Beach volleyball]] is a popular variant with two players per team and a slightly different set of rules.

title: subaru_impreza
body:
Flagship [[car]] for [[Subaru (brand)|]]. 
Across all of its incarnations, the Impreza has always been deeply associated with the World Rally Championship, usually in the Subaru World Rally Team blue in contrast to its biggest rival, the usually Marlboro/Ralliart red [[mitsubishi motors|Mitsubishi]] [[mitsubishi lancer evolution|Lancer Evolution]]. 

[[Initial D]]'s [[Fujiwara Bunta]] owns a GC8 model Impreza WRX STi Coupé Ver. V (its anime installment being in Sonic Blue Mica, whereas the car is Gun Metal Gray in the manga), which he deems a "practical, everyday car".

title: qu_(all_tomorrows)
body:
Alien race from the speculative evolution novel [[all tomorrows|All Tomorrows]]. They are responsible for the myriad of posthuman species within the setting after a one-sided conflict against a spacefaring humanity.

They are thin, insectoid beings with four [[wings]], a long [[prehensile tail]], and a head with two stalked eyes and a mouth with [[mandibles]].

title: colonial_(all_tomorrows)
body:
One of the posthuman species in [[All Tomorrows]]. They were originally a human colony that had the most success fighting the [[Qu (all tomorrows)|]], being able to repel the Qu invasions twice before being defeated.

As punishment for their defiance, the Qu turned them into little more than sheets of skin and flesh that acted as filter feeders. To further their punishment, the Qu let them retain eyes and sentience so that they could fully experience their own suffering.

title: killer_folk
body:
One of the posthuman species in [[All Tomorrows]]. They are one of the species that rose after the [[Qu (all tomorrows)|]] left, evolving from the Human Predators.

They have animalistic features with [[fangs]] and [[spotted fur]]. Their thumbs became a hook-like claws while their last two digits were rotated perpendicularly to take its place as opposable digits.

title: temptor_(all_tomorrows)
body: One of the posthuman species in [[All Tomorrows]]. They are a species with extreme sexual dimorphism: the females are large, sessile, tree-like beings with a beak and half their bodies underground; the males are smaller, ape-like drones who are controlled by the females through vocalizations and pheromones.

title: lopsider
body: One of the posthuman species in [[All Tomorrows]]. They are flat, asymmetrical creatures that inhabit a planet with high gravity.

title: sternritter
body: The Sternritter (German for Star Knights) are a group of powerful [[Quincy (bleach)|]] in the [[Wandenreich]]'s army in the manga series [[Bleach]], debuting in the [[Bleach: Sennen Kessen-hen|Thousand-Year Blood War]] arc. They all wear variations of the [[Wandenreich uniform]].

title: zangetsu_(bleach)
body:
[[Kurosaki Ichigo]]'s Zanpakuto, manifesting as a tall man with [[facial hair]] and [[long hair|long]], [[black hair]], and wears [[sunglasses]] with a [[black coat]] that covers most of his body.

In Bankai form, he becomes a younger version of himself, with shorter hair, no facial hair, and no sunglasses.

[spoilers]During the [[Bleach: Sennen Kessen-hen|Thousand-Year Blood War]], it is revealed that the person formally identified as Zangetsu is in fact a manifestation of Ichigo’s Quincy powers, being a portion of [[Yhwach]]'s soul.[/spoilers]

title: chilchuck_tims
body:
Chilchuck is an [[halfling]] adventurer in [[Dungeon Meshi]]. He's one of the main protagonists, and handles locked doors and traps on the party's behalf. He has [[brown hair]], [[black eyes]], and wears [[leather armor]], [[black pants]], [[fingerless gloves]], and a green thing that is officially [i]not[/i] a scarf.

He has 3 daughters: [[Mayjack (dungeon meshi)|]], [[Fullertom (dungeon meshi)|]], and [[Packpatty (dungeon meshi)|]].

title: baba_shizue
body: Character from [[Yoru no Kurage wa oyogenai]]. Her stage name is Miiko, and she has a daughter called [[Baba Ariel]].

title: kurosawa_ruby
body:
One of the main characters of [[Love Live! Sunshine!!]]. She frightens easily (and tends to emit a distinctive "pigii!" shriek), but loves school idols and always dreamed of becoming one. Ruby is the shy younger sister of [[Kurosawa Dia]], and a close friend with [[Kunikida Hanamaru]].

Ruby is a member of the Aqours sub-unit [[cyaron! (love live!)|CYaRon!]], alongside [[Takami Chika]] and [[Watanabe You]].

She has [[aqua eyes]] and [[red hair|red]] [[two side up]].

Voiced by [[Furihata Ai]].

title: cyaron!_(love_live!)
body:
[b]CYaRon![/b] is a sub-unit from [[Love Live! Sunshine!!]]. It consists of three members: [[Takami Chika]], [[Watanabe You]] and [[Kurosawa Ruby]]

CYaRon!'s name is a combination of the initial letters of the sub-unit members' first names- "C" of Chika, "Y" of You, and "R" of Ruby

h6. Main singles

* [[genki zenkai day! day! day!|Genki Zenkai DAY! DAY! DAY!]]

body:

title: hands_on_another's_arms
body:
When both of a character's hands are on another character's arms.

If a single hand is involved, use [[hand on another's arm]].

h4. See Also
* [[hands on own arms]]
* [[Tag group:Hands]]

title: hands_on_own_arms
body:
When a character has both of their hands placed on their own arms.

If only one hand is involved, use [[hand on own arm]].
