* [[hands on another's arm]]
* [[hands on another's arms]]
* [[Tag group:Hands]]

title: hand_on_another's_arm
body:
When a character's hand is on another character's arm.

If both hands are involved, use [[hands on another's arm]], and if they are on both arms, use [[hands on another's arms]].

h4. See Also
* [[hand on own arm]]
* [[Tag group:Hands]]

title: hand_on_own_arm
body:
When a character has one of their hands placed on their own arm.

If both hands are involved, use [[hands on own arms]].

h4. See Also
* [[hand on another's arm]]
* [[Tag group:Hands]]

title: hands_on_another's_stomach
body:
When one character has both of their hands on someone else's abdominal region.

If there's only one hand on another's stomach, use [[hand on another's stomach]]
If a hand is on one's own stomach, use [[hand on own stomach]]
If both hands are on one's own stomach, use [[hands on own stomach]]

h4. See Also
* [[Tag group:Hands]]

title: hand_on_another's_stomach
body:
When one character has one hand on someone else's abdominal region.

If both hands are on someone else's stomach, use [[hands on another's stomach]]
If a hand is on one's own stomach, use [[hand on own stomach]]
If both hands are on one's own stomach, use [[hands on own stomach]]

h4. See Also
* [[Tag group:Hands]]

title: hand_on_own_stomach
body:
When a person has one of their hands resting upon their abdominal region.

If both hands are on their stomach, use [[hands on own stomach]]
If a hand is on someone else's stomach, use [[hand on another's stomach]]
If both hands are on someone else's stomach, use [[hands on another's stomach]]

h4. See Also
* [[Tag group:Hands]]

title: hands_on_another's_shoulders
body:
When both of one character's hands are on both of another's shoulders.

If only one hand is involved, use [[hand on another's shoulder]].

h4. See Also
* [[Tag group:Hands]]

title: hands_on_another's_back
body:
When both a character's hands are on another character's [[back]].

If a single hand is involved, use [[hand on another's back]].

h4. See Also
* [[Tag group:Hands]]

title: hand_on_another's_back
body:
When a character's hand is on another character's [[back]].

If both hands are involved, use [[hands on another's back]].

h4. See Also
* [[Tag group:Hands]]

title: hands_on_another's_chest
body:
One character is resting [b]both[/b] of their hands on someone else's chest, regardless if it's a male's chest or a female's [[breasts]].

If only one hand is involved, use [[hand on another's chest]].

h4.See also

* [[covering another's breasts]]
* [[grabbing another's breast]]
* [[hands on own chest]]
* [[Tag group:Hands]]

title: hands_on_another's_neck
body:
A less violent form of [[strangling]], where one person is gently resting both of their hands upon someone else's neck. This could be for affection, or to help them put on a piece of neckwear or a [[necklace]].

If only one hand is involved, use [[hand on another's neck]].

h4. See also

* [[hands on own neck]]
* [[strangling]]
* [[Tag group:Hands]]

title: hands_on_own_neck
body:
When a character has both of their hands on their own neck.

If only one hand is involved, use [[hand on own neck]].

h1. See also
* [[hands on another's neck]]
* [[Tag group:Hands]]

title: hand_on_another's_neck
body:
When one character has one of their hands on another character's neck, whether it be on the nape of their neck at the back, or in the front.

If both hands are involved, use [[hands on another's neck]].

h4. See also

* [[hand on own neck]]
* [[Tag group:Hands]]

title: hands_on_own_chin
body:
When a character has both of their hands on their own chin, such as in post #3967913, often as a form of [[head rest]].

If only one hand is involved, use [[hand on own chin]].


h4. See also

* [[stroking own chin]]
* [[hand on another's chin]]
* [[Tag group:Hands]]

title: hands_on_own_cheeks
body:
When a character has placed [b]both[/b] of their own hands upon their own cheeks. 

If the character has only one hand on one cheek, use [[hand_on_own_cheek]] instead.
If one character is placing their hands on someone else's cheeks, use [[hands_on_another's_cheeks]] instead.

h4. See also
* [[hands framing own cheeks]]
* [[Tag group:Hands]]

title: hands_on_another's_cheeks
body:
When [b]both[/b] of one character's hands are on someone else's cheeks. 

If only one hand is involved, use [[hand on another's cheek]].

title: mining_helmet
body: A type of [[hard hat]] worn specifically for [[mining]]. Can be distinguished from a regular [[hard hat]] by its inclusion of a [[headlamp]] to help illuminate caves.

title: headlamp
body:
A type of small [[flashlight]] (or other similar illuminating device) worn on the head to provide light while leaving the hands free. 

Often attached to a [[headband]] or [[hard hat]] (such as a [[mining helmet]]), but may also be affixed directly to the head.

title: two-tone_skin
body:
A [[colored skin]] that is two-toned (comprised of only two colors). Normally occurring colors like [[tan]], [[bruise]]s etc don't apply.

Both skin colors should be tagged, if possible.

h4. See also

* [[Multicolored Skin]]
* [[Gradient Skin]]
* [[Tag group:Skin Color]]

title: multicolored_skin
body:
When a character has two or more distinct colors making up their layer of skin. All skin colors present should be tagged, if possible.

This doesn't include naturally occurring differences in colors such as [[areolae]], [[nipples]], [[bruise]]s, [[tan]] and [[blush|blushing]] to name a few. At least one of the skin colors has to be [[colored skin|unnatural]] and the colors have to be visually distinct from each other. 

For instance, post #472760 has [[blue skin]] and [[red skin]] divided evenly on her flesh.

h4. See also
* [[two-tone skin]]
* [[Vitiligo]]

title: patchwork_skin
body:
For when a character has skin that has been stitched together in multiple places, possibly from multiple sources.

If the skin patches are differently colored, [[multicolored skin]] may apply as well.

h4. See Also
* [[Multicolored skin]]
* [[Two-tone skin]]

title: gradient_skin
body:
A specific type of [[multicolored skin]] where a character or person depicted has skin that blends and gradually changes from one color to one or more other colors.

All skin colors in the gradient should be tagged, if possible.

h4. See Also:

* [[Colored extremities]]
* [[Gradient]]
* [[Two-tone skin]]
* [[Tag group:skin color]]

title: open_hoodie
body:

title: convention
body:
An event where people share their love for some subject (Ex: animecon).

A popular event at anime conventions is the selling of [[doujins]] by various authors at the author’s respective tables, so if the image shows a table with doujins stacked on it, the author sitting on one side, and people lining up to buy them from the other side, the setting of the image is probably a convention.

title: ushio_tetsu
body: The bully from the original [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] manga's first chapter who abused his power at school. He was the first victim of [[Yami Yugi]]. He lost to [[Muto_Yugi|Yugi]]'s dark personality in a Shadow Game, forcing him into a penalty. Somehow, he recovered from that and became a member of Sector Security in [[Yu-Gi-Oh! 5D's]].

title: delta_gundam_kai
body:
Prototype transformable [[mobile suit]] developed from the [[Delta Plus]] as a technology demonstrator. Contains the NITRO system, allowing non-Newtypes to use the pair of prototype [[Fin Funnels]] equipped on the machine. Its frame has been enhanced with extra thrusters, allowing it to fly both in space and in the atmosphere.

Armed with a shield that doubles as the Delta Kai's forward section in Waverider Mode; the shield also carries a pair of beam sabers that double as beam guns when transformed and a mounting section for a variety of experimental weapons.

A hand-held beam cannon called a "Long Mega Buster" rounds out its weapon loadout.

This suit appears in Mobile Suit [[Gundam Unicorn]]: UC 0094 - Across the Sky, the Mobile Suit Gundam Unicorn video game and UC: MSV.

[b]NOTE:[/b] The HGUC kit contains extra parts from the Delta Plus mold, such as an extra Beam Rifle.

title: delta_gundam
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series.

[b]MSN-001 Delta Gundam[/b] 

A state-of-the-art (at the time) prototype transformable [[mobile suit]] from the [[Zeta Gundam]] era in the Universal Century. Has anti-beam coating and atmospheric flight capability. However, due to its transformation placing too much stress on the frame, it remained a prototype and simulator data -- what was supposed to be the Delta was later repurposed into a high-performance Mobile Suit -- the [[Hyaku Shiki]].

The concept of the Delta was later revisited after advances in mobile suit design made it feasible, resulting in the limited-run [[Delta Plus]] and [[Fin Funnels|Fin Funnel]] testbed [[Delta Gundam Kai]].

In a nod to its repurposing, the simulation of the Delta Gundam is based on the piloting data of [[Quattro Bajeena]], the pilot of the aforementioned Hyaku Shiki.

title: smithers_scared_of_strippers_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originating from a scene in [[The Simpsons]], season 13 episode 04 "A Hunka Hunka Burns in Love".

In the episode, [[montgomery_burns|Mr. Burns]] goes searching for a girlfriend with his assistant [[Waylon Smithers]]. They cluelessly enter a strip club before realizing what it is. As Burns turns to leave, he looks back and sees Smithers cornered by two strippers dancing teasingly at him. Smithers, a gay man, recoils and groans in horror.

h4. External link

* "The scene in Frinkiac":[https://frinkiac.com/caption/S13E04/379921]

title: selectovision_(meme)
body:
A political cartoon depicting one man brandishing a [[knife]] and chasing another, with a third man recording the two on a [[video camera]]. Through the video camera, it appears as though the man being chased is threatening the actual aggressor with a knife, reversing the reality of the situation. 

The original cartoon was a work by David Suter called Selectovision, published in 1985. Online, the image is often circulated with the text "It's Media" or "The Media Shows You What They Want".

h4. Original
* !asset #20983868: Selectovision (1985)

title: ryouki_(senran_kagura)
body:
A character from [[Senran Kagura]], and one of the five new characters in [[Senran Kagura Estival Versus]].

She is the (formerly) deceased sister of [[Ryoubi (senran kagura)|]] and [[Ryouna (senran kagura)|]]. During the Estival Versus, she was revived by [[Syuri (senran kagura)|]] and her company during the special Kagura Festival.

When [[Ryoubi (senran kagura)|]] and [[Ryouna (senran kagura)|]] were younger, Ryoki would take care of them like any parent would. This is all that she would do, until she was enrolled into Gessen Girls' Academy. Afterwards, was sent on a mission to take on yoma, but died during that mission. It was later revealed that a yoma killed her, but until [[Rin (senran kagura)|]] had given her two younger sisters that information, they believed it was [[Miyabi (senran kagura)|]], who had killed everyone in a rampage, using the Forbidden Ninja Art: Blood Riot. However, the only one killed by Blood Riot was the yoma, everyone else died before the activation of the forbidden technique. In addition to her shotgun shield, she also uses her [[coffin]] as a weapon.

Since she hasn't been completely brought back to life per se, she still has a [[halo]] hovering over her head. She also derives much pleasure from hearing Buddhist sutras being told.

Her voice actress is [[Inoue Kikuko]].

h4. See Aslo
* "Kagurapedia: Ryouki":https://senrankagura.fandom.com/wiki/Ry%C5%8Dki

title: kagehira_mika
body:
[i][[Ensemble Stars!]][/i] character. A second year student and member of [[valkyrie (ensemble stars!)|Valkyrie]]. 

He has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] and [[heterochromia]]. At school, he wears the standard [[yumenosaki school uniform|Yumenosaki uniform]], consisting on [[plaid pants]], a [[blazer]] with a [[sweater vest]] and a [[necktie]]. For Valkyrie, he wears a [[frilled jacket]] and a [[long coat]] with [[boots]].

He is very devoted to [[itsuki shu|Shu Itsuki]] because he called out to him when he was alone. But Shu ignores and belittles him in return. He has an honest and gullible personality, but can easily become lonely and broody. He likes cute and scary things, but has very few friends because he has difficulties finding people who share his interests. He has a complex about his girlish name and mismatched eyes. Mika has a heavy Osaka accent and has a lot of part-time jobs to support Valkyrie, since Shu doesn't like to deal with crowds.

[[anzu (ensemble stars!)|Anzu]] likes him because he resembles her friend [[kuromori suzu|Suzu Kuromori]]. Unfortunately, Mika tries to avoid her because Shu resents her for defeating Fine with Trickstar. They eventually became good friends, with Anzu befriending him the same way she did with Suzu in the past.

title: count_dooku
body:
A character from the [[Star Wars]] science fiction and [[fantasy]] universe.

[b]Count Dooku[/b] is a [[Sith]] Lord that appeared in the second and third prequel films in the saga.

He was played by legendary [[United Kingdom|British]] actor [[Christopher Lee]]. The name of the character is a tribute to Count [[Dracula]], a supernatural villain Lee played in a series of horror films during the 1950s, 1960s and 1970s.

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Count_Dooku]

title: kune-kune
body:
くねくね ([i]Kune-kune[/i], an onomatopoeia meaning "wiggle-waggle") is an [[urban legend]] that has been going around the Internet since 2003. In this scary story appears an unidentifiable being.

Although the story has a number of patterns, the most representative storyline is the one where "the narrator wanders around the countryside in the summer, near a paddy field or a river, and sees a white thing that wiggles its body in a manner far different from that of any person or living creature. He asks his companion what that thing might be. His friend uses binoculars in order to verify the actual shape of the thing, and as soon as he understands what it is, his mouth seizes up with fear and he becomes insane."

The locals know that "when you see the wiggle-waggle, once you understand what it is, it has an abnormal effect on your soul," and they regard it as taboo. In the stories, sometimes there can be a warning from the local elders who say "if you see such a thing, you should not get close; you should quickly forget you ever saw it."

Not to be mistaken for the visually similar [[Hattifattener]] from The [[Moomin]]s.

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

h4.External Links

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kunekune_%28Yokai%29
* ”It’s better if you don’t know” "[Original Japanese]":[http://syarecowa.moo.jp/6/212.htm] "[English translation]":[http://sharekowa.tumblr.com/post/87647754633/its-better-if-you-dont-know] - The probable earliest origin of the stories, posted on a [[2channel]] thread in July 2001. At that time  the creature had no name.

title: remove_before_flight_tag
body: The “Remove Before Flight” tag is an integral safety sign for aircraft maintenance and notifies aircraft personnel that its attached component needs removal before use. The tags are checked during ground handling processes, usually as part of a standardized checklist. Failure to remove the tag and its attachment can result in terrible consequences ranging from a simple part failure to a complete aircraft shutdown.

title: paixiao
body:
Paixiao,a type of Chinese musical instrumen.

Chinese bamboo panpipe, generally a series of bamboo tubes secured together by rows of bamboo strips, wooden strips, or ropes. The instrument is blown across the top end. Although 16 pipes have become the standard, other groupings (from 13 to 24) have been made. Before the Tang dynasty (AD 618–907) the panpipe was called xiao.

title: strategic_cruiser_(eve_online)
body:
A type of [[spacecraft]] from the [[EVE Online]].
Versatile ships that can be reconfigured for a variety of [[Attack ship (EVE Online)|attack]], [[Combat ship (EVE Online)|combat]], disruption or support roles.

Strategic cruisers (also T3Cs) are the [[Tech 3 ship (EVE Online)|Tech 3]] variant of the [[cruiser (EVE Online)|]]s. They are the evolution of Sleeper technology into the currently known technology base. In practical terms, they are expensive, powerful, and extremely customizable cruiser-sized ships.
Strategic cruisers have four subsystem slots designed to create a single ship, each holding a part of the ship's basic layout and carrying its own set of bonuses. No strategic cruiser can be fielded if it lacks any of the four subsystem slots. Each race has developed its own set of subsystems for each ship, and these subsystems are not interchangeable between different races' strategic cruisers. Each subsystem has an associated skill, and when combined provide Strategic Cruisers with many more bonuses than any other ships.
To further improve their flexibility, strategic cruisers are also the only ships capable of having Rigs removed from them without destroying them, allowing a single strat cruiser hull to completely refit and change its role in a matter of seconds. To encourage on-the-fly reconfigurations (using a Mobile Depot for example), they also come with an extra cargo bay especially for storing subsystems. And to further encourage pushing the ships to their limits in the field, the main strategic cruiser skill itself does not provide direct combat bonuses, but instead reduces the overheat damage sustained by the ship's modules, and increases the speed of using Nanite Repair Paste to repair overheat damage.
It takes a lot of effort to build a strategic cruiser, and they consequently cost a lot. Most primary components of Tech 3 production are found in Wormholes, and some of the rarer gases and components are not available outside of Dangerous or Deadly Unknown systems.
The following are the strategic cruisers, by race:
* [[Amarr Empire (EVE Online)|]] [[Legion (EVE Online)|]]
* [[Caldari State (EVE Online)|]] [[Tengu (EVE Online)|]]
* [[Gallente Federation (EVE Online)|]] [[Proteus (EVE Online)|]]
* [[Minmatar Republic (EVE Online)|]] [[Loki (EVE Online)|]]

h5. External links: 
https://wiki.eveuniversity.org/Strategic_Cruisers

title: corvette_(eve_online)
body:
A type of [[spacecraft|spaceships]] from the [[EVE Online]].
Starting ships given free of charge, suitable for interstellar travel.

Little more than slower, armed shuttles, corvettes (formerly known as "rookies", "rookie ships" or "noobships") are the basic ships that new pilots start with. You can acquire your faction's corvette by clicking the "Board my Corvette" button whenever you are docked. It will be fitted with a civilian weapon, a civilian mining laser, and a civilian afterburner. If you already have a corvette in that structure, you will board that one, and its fit will be the fit before you entered it. While corvettes aren't suited for serious combat, people field fleets composed entirely of corvettes, more for their comedy value than for their effectiveness in battle.

h5. External links: 
https://wiki.eveuniversity.org/Corvettes

title: pirate_faction_(eve_online)
body:
A type of factions in the [[EVE Online]].

Non-Empire Faction ships are bought from non-empire faction loyalty point stores, including Pirate factions, and others, such as [[Servant Sisters Of EVE]]; and single-run blueprints for them can be found by destroying rare commander and sometimes tougher NPCs in certain combat sites. They can also be purchased second-hand from players on the market. These ships require two different races' Spaceship Command skills to use. For example, the Dramiel, an [[Angel Cartel (EVE Online)|]] [[frigate (EVE Online)|]], requires both [[Minmatar Republic (EVE Online)|Minmatar]] and [[Gallente Federation (EVE Online)|Gallente]] frigate skills. However, they do not require high levels in these skills, making them considerably easier to train for than [[Tech 2 ship (EVE Online)|]]s. Non-Empire ships typically have equal or better performance to Tech 2 ships, including very powerful unique bonuses specific to their pirate faction, but also cost considerably more than Tech 2 ships and do not benefit from T2 resist bonuses.

title: battlecruiser_(eve_online)
body:
A type of [[spacecraft|spaceships]] from the [[EVE Online]].
Flexible fitting vessels that bridge the gap between [[cruiser (EVE Online)|]]s and [[battleship (EVE Online)|]]s.

Battlecruisers are larger, slower and have more slots than cruisers, but they're smaller than battleships and fit the same medium-sized weapons that cruisers use. They occupy a position between cruisers and battleships analogous to [[destroyer (EVE Online)|]]s' position between [[frigate (EVE Online)|]]s and cruisers, although battlecruisers are much more versatile and widely-used than destroyers. Most battlecruisers can mount Command Bursts, modules capable of giving significant bonuses to nearby allied ships. Tech 1 battlecruisers are the least character-skill-intensive and most accessible hull with this ability.
One group of [[Tech 2 ship (EVE Online)|]]s, Command Ships, are based on battlecruiser hulls. Command Ships are more durable and dangerous versions of their Tech 1 base hulls, with space for more Command Bursts and bonuses to either the strength or the range of their bursts.

h5. External links: 
https://wiki.eveuniversity.org/Battlecruisers
